intro: Corothamnus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its clustered, small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has hairy, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Corothamnus multiflorus is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds.
